message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and Trading Across Borders database, this paper analyses the impact of trade facilitation measures on firm-level export outcomes in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Trading Across Borders"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) to investigate the determinants of child malnutrition in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a unique longitudinal dataset of smallholder farmers in Kenya that tracks landscape features over time using high-resolution satellite imagery.", "dataset": ["longitudinal dataset of smallholder farmers in Kenya", "high-resolution satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This research relies on household data from the Mexican Family Life Survey (MxFLS) and the first wave (2011) of the Health and Retirement Study (HRS) in the United States.", "dataset": ["Mexican Family Life Survey (MxFLS)", "Health and Retirement Study (HRS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We combine survey data from more than 40 countries with harmonized data on firms to investigate the relationship between women's leadership in firms and exporting behaviour.", "dataset": ["survey data from more than 40 countries", "harmonized data on firms"], "topic": ["Gender", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines patterns of natural disaster reporting through event categories and affected sector types using data from EM-DAT, which is an international disaster database maintained by the Centre for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters (CRED).", "dataset": ["EM-DAT"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use a newly compiled dataset, the Subnational Public Investment Database (SPI), which provides cross-country comparisons on public investment at the state and municipal level in Brazil, Mexico, and Nigeria from 2002 to 2018.", "dataset": ["Subnational Public Investment Database (SPI)"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This research analyzes data from two sources of digital financial transaction data: mobile money transactions collected by Tigo Tanzania and Point-of-Sale (POS) transactions collected among small and medium-sized merchants in Antananarivo, Madagascar.", "dataset": ["mobile money transactions collected by Tigo Tanzania", "Point-of-Sale (POS) transactions collected among small and medium-sized merchants in Antananarivo, Madagascar"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We combine spatial data on established and proposed protected areas with socioeconomic data on over 4 million households drawn from multiple census rounds and surveys in Mexico.", "dataset": ["spatial data on established and proposed protected areas", "socioeconomic data on over 4 million households drawn from multiple census rounds and surveys in Mexico"], "topic": ["Environment", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measuring Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) in Nigeria and Tanzania and household-level expenditure data from the same source to analyze national consumption patterns and their implications for agriculture-led growth in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measuring Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) in Nigeria and Tanzania"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use high-resolution satellite imagery and household survey data from Ethiopia to identify the impact of road construction on poverty reduction and welfare effects.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite imagery", "household survey data from Ethiopia"], "topic": ["Transport", "Poverty"]}]
